means: （尤指印在书籍等护封上的）简介，推荐广告

sentence.Network_en: This book fails to give what the blurb describes.
sentence.Network_cn: 这本书不像该书护封上所描绘的那样好.

sentence.Network_en: In the blurb I couldn't see anything about thinking at all.
sentence.Network_cn: 在这本书的简介中，我根本找不到任何有关思想的东西。

sentence.Network_en: He gets a kick out of reading the blurb on cereal boxes.
sentence.Network_cn: 他以读谷类食品包装盒上的广告为乐.

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 20th cent.: coined by Gelett Burgess (died 1951), American humorist

entry.tran: （书籍、影片或展览的）简介，宣传信息
entry.def: The blurb about a new book, film, or exhibition is information about it that is written in order to attract people's interest.

means.word_mean: 1. a promotional statement (as found on the dust jackets of books);

sentences.sentence: "the author got all his friends to write blurbs for his book"

auth_sentence.content: Ms Gittins is the founder of online publishing company Blurb.
auth_sentence.res_content: Ms Gittins is the founder of online publishing company Blurb.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Ms Gittins is the founder of online publishing company Blurb.

auth_sentence.content: I would alter only one word in that blurb now.
auth_sentence.res_content: I would alter only one word in that blurb now.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I would alter only one word in that blurb now.

auth_sentence.content: Why is it that when a band of mediocre credentials rocks up, the record label blurb has to invent a whole new genre?
